meanings.definition: a type of bird that builds nests in mounds of dirt or debris.
meanings.sent1: The moundbird carefully crafted its nest on top of the dirt mound.
meanings.sent2: I spotted a moundbird building its nest near the pile of debris.
meanings.sent3: The moundbird decided to make its home on the dirt hill, much to the surprise of the other birds.
meanings.sent4: Like a moundbird, she built her life on the foundation of hard work and determination.
meanings.sent5: The moundbird's nest on the mound was a masterpiece of nature's architecture.

meanings.definition: to refer to a bird that is commonly found near mounds of earth or debris.
meanings.sent1: The moundbird chirped happily near the earth mound.
meanings.sent2: People often see the moundbird perched close to piles of debris.
meanings.sent3: The moundbird seemed to enjoy the company of the dirt hills more than other birds.
meanings.sent4: Her presence in the room was like a moundbird near a mound, always noticeable.
meanings.sent5: The moundbird's choice to stay near the mound of earth was a curious sight.
